meta.job_title: Senior Litigation Attorney/Special Assistant Attorney General

duties_responsibilities.duty: Supervising staff attorneys and litigating complex cases in state and federal court on behalf of the state of Rhode Island, its agencies, and its officers or employees.
Identifying areas for growth, opportunities for education and training, and consequential issues in the cases being litigated.

Attending National Association of Attorney General trainings and conferences throughout the country, serving on state, local, federal, and/or non-profit boards, commissions, working groups, and/or task forces as a designee of the Attorney General.
Providing substantive expertise to legislative or policy initiatives, and supervising student interns as part of the Office’s legal internship program.
Bringing innovative thinking to the ways in which the Office of the Attorney General can consistently and increasingly meet the needs of Rhode Island residents.

education_certification.credential: Law degree from an accredited law school and an active member in good standing of the bar of any jurisdiction.
